title: What kind of bankruptcy should I file?
question: I have manslaughter while intoxicated driving and served my sentence. The victim died but the family has not filed any action against me. Can I file bankruptcy on my medical bills? Can I file bankruptcy on my student loan?
answers: You can probably wipe out your medical bills. Students loans probably not however. Before going into a bankruptcy you should speak with an experienced bankruptcy attorney. Bankruptcy can get complex quickly and you need the advice of a bankruptcy attorney to help you spot red flags and to help you navigate through the legal process. You can find many good bankruptcy attorneys here on AVVO.

I agree with Mr. Steingraber. Your student loans are a completely different issue and have nothing to do with your DUI. You would need to speak with a bankruptcy attorney who is well versed in Student Loan Law.

Yes you can file a bankruptcy petition and discharge your unsecured debts including your medical bills. You can schedule a potential debt which you believe may arise as a result of your DUI. However that debt may not be discharged if the plaintiff proceeds to file a lawsuit against you. Then it would be up to the plaintiff to seek a determination of whether or not the debt that you allegedly with all them could be discharged. There are specific exceptions to discharge of debts involving driving while intoxicated. Whatever you do get the advice of an experienced bankruptcy counsel before you proceed. You can find review and hire an AVVO bankruptcy attorney by using the find a lawyer feature on this website good luck to you
